metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5018 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome prior to 56.0.2924.76 for Linux, Windows and Mac, and 56.0.2924.87 for Android, had an insufficiently strict content security policy on the Chrome app launcher page, which allowed a remote attacker to inject scripts or HTML into a privileged page via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
